meanings.definition: To move with a lurching gait.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog was humping along the road.
meanings.sent2: The old car was humping down the bumpy hill.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown was humping around the circus tent.
meanings.sent4: The boat was humping through the rough waves.
meanings.sent5: The heavy suitcase was humping up the stairs.

meanings.definition: To carry, especially on the back.
meanings.sent1: The porter was humping the heavy bags at the train station.
meanings.sent2: The ant was humping a leaf back to its nest.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was humping people to safety during the disaster.
meanings.sent4: The worker was humping bricks to the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The student was humping books to the library for research.

meanings.sent1: The animals were humping in the field.
meanings.sent2: The birds were humping in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The awkward couple was caught humping in the park.
meanings.sent4: The insects were humping under the leaf.
meanings.sent5: The teenagers were humping behind the school.
